skill.name: sql-expert
skill.description: Expert SQL query writing, optimization, and database schema design with support for PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, and SQL Server. Use when working with databases for: (1) Writing complex SQL queries with joins, subqueries, and window functions, (2) Optimizing slow queries and analyzing execution plans, (3) Designing database schemas with proper normalization, (4) Creating indexes and improving query performance, (5) Writing migrations and handling schema changes, (6) Debugging SQL errors and query issues
skill.summary: Expert SQL query writing, optimization, and database schema design with support for PostgreSQL, MySQ...
skill.author: AutumnsGrove

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate educational and reference skill containing SQL documentation, patterns, and a Python helper utility. The Python script uses SQLAlchemy ORM with parameterized queries. No malicious patterns detected. Behavior matches stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Writing complex SQL queries and optimizing database performance requires deep knowledge of query patterns, indexing strategies, and database-specific syntax. This skill provides expert guidance for building efficient queries, designing normalized schemas, and troubleshooting performance issues across PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, and SQL Server.
actual_capabilities: Write complex queries with JOINs, CTEs, subqueries, and window functions
Analyze query performance using EXPLAIN plans and execution statistics
Design normalized database schemas following 1NF, 2NF, and 3NF principles
Create effective indexes for query performance optimization
Write safe database migrations with rollback support
Debug SQL errors and resolve query issues
limitations: Does not execute queries on user databases directly
Does not provide database hosting or connection management
Does not install or configure database software
Examples are templates that require adaptation to specific schemas

use_cases.title: Query Reference
use_cases.description: Quickly find correct SQL syntax for joins, aggregations, and complex queries

use_cases.title: Performance Tuning
use_cases.description: Optimize slow queries using EXPLAIN plans, index recommendations, and query patterns

use_cases.title: Schema and Migrations
use_cases.description: Design normalized schemas and create safe, zero-downtime migration scripts

prompt_templates.title: Basic Query
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a SQL query to select [columns] from [table] where [condition] and order by [column] limit [number]

prompt_templates.title: Complex Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a query using window functions to calculate [ranking/running total/percentile] partitioned by [column] ordered by [column]

prompt_templates.title: Schema Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design SQL tables for [use case] following third normal form with proper foreign keys and constraints

prompt_templates.title: Performance Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this query for performance issues and suggest optimizations using indexes and query restructuring: [paste query]

output_examples.input: Write a query to find the top 5 customers by order total with their last order date
output: Query uses a CTE to aggregate order totals per customer
Uses ROW_NUMBER() window function for ranking
Includes proper JOIN between customers and orders tables
Filters to top 5 with ORDER BY and LIMIT

best_practices: Always use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection attacks
Index foreign key columns and frequently filtered columns for better performance
Use transactions for related operations to ensure atomicity
anti_patterns: Avoid SELECT * - specify only needed columns to reduce data transfer
Do not use functions on indexed columns in WHERE clauses
Never concatenate user input directly into SQL query strings

faq.question: Which databases are supported?
faq.answer: Supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, and SQL Server with dialect-specific syntax and functions

faq.question: How does this skill optimize queries?
faq.answer: Uses EXPLAIN plan analysis, identifies missing indexes, and suggests query rewrites

faq.question: Can I use this with an ORM like SQLAlchemy?
faq.answer: Yes, helper scripts integrate with SQLAlchemy for ORM-based database operations

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Skill only provides patterns and guidance. Queries are not executed on your databases without your explicit action

faq.question: Why is my query slow?
faq.answer: Common causes include missing indexes, full table scans, or inefficient JOINs. Use EXPLAIN to identify bottlenecks

faq.question: How do I handle NULL values correctly?
faq.answer: Use IS NULL and IS NOT NULL for comparisons. Use COALESCE to provide default values
